oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Broadside featuring sketched portraits of the Republican candidates by John Doctoroff, with 1928 copyright. Trades Council Union Label over oval Allied Printing , St. Louis, Mo.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Broadsides; Political posters; Portraits
Broadsides; Hoover, Herbert, 1874-1964; United States - Politics and government - 1919-1933; Curtis, Charles, 1860-1936
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Allied Printing
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Republican Herbert Hoover, from Iowa, was U.S. Secretary of Commerce. Curtis was Senate Majority leader and came from Kansas. The ticket defeated Democrats Al Smith and Joseph T. Robinson by 444 electoral votes to 87.
